data.title: vivo launches X300 Series with 200 MP ZEISS camera to mark 30th anniversary, enhancing flagship excellence.
data.description: In Shenzhen, China on October 30, 2025, vivo unveiled the global debut of its newest X-series flagship phones, the X300 and X300 Pro. These releases mark vivo's 30th anniversary, highlighting the brand's dedication to innovation centered around user needs.

data.title: XRP trades around $2.63 as Fed cuts rates by 25 points, with focus on crypto inflows. Read more for details.
data.description: After the Federal Reserve announced a 25 basis point rate cut, XRP is currently trading at around $2.63. Investors are closely monitoring the potential impact of this move on cryptocurrency inflows.
Some ECB policymakers think a 2028 inflation projection below 2% would warrant a rate cut debate, others favour giving little weight to any small undershooting three years ahead - Sources.
ECB policymakers prepare for December showdown on inflation, and rates - Sources.

data.title: Duke Energy Foundation donates $100,000 to One SC Fund for hunger relief; plans $500,000 for 60 feeding programs in SC amid uncertainties, totaling over $2.6 million in support since 2021.
data.description: Furthermore, during the month of November, the company will allocate an additional $500,000 to support a minimum of 60 feeding programs across the state, in light of financial uncertainties as colder temperatures and the holiday season draw near. Between 2021 and now, Duke Energy and the Foundation have committed over $2.6 million to offer assistance.

data.title: New book reveals US strategy to target Sinaloa Cartel and Chinese suppliers, fighting fentanyl crisis.
data.description: Today, a newly released book sheds light on the initial U.S. effort to disband the Sinaloa Cartel and its Chinese drug manufacturers. Titled "Fentanyl: Fighting the Mass Poisoning of America and the Cartel Behind It" (published by Bloomsbury Academic), authored by Jake Braun, the book delves into strategies employed.

data.title: Boston.com marks 30 years as Boston's go-to news source since 1995, delivering local stories and breaking news.
data.description: In Boston, on October 30, 2025, the 30th anniversary of Boston.com was celebrated. Boston.com has been serving as a reliable digital news platform for the Greater Boston area since its establishment in October 1995. The platform has been dedicated to providing breaking news, local stories, and information to its audience over the past three decades.
NY Fed Accepts $4 Bln of $4 Bln Submitted To SRF

data.title: Alphabet CEO Sundar Pichai hints at transformative AI-driven search strategy shift, possible new 'universal search,' with record $102.3 billion in revenue.
data.description: Alphabet Inc.'s CEO Sundar Pichai recently discussed the evolution of search at the third-quarter earnings call, hinting at a possible shift towards AI-driven search. Pichai mentioned that AI could soon be as transformative as Googleâ€™s universal search launch. This shift could lead to a unified search experience powered by Gemini. Pichai highlighted the importance of meeting users in the moment through AI overviews and AI mode. The news follows Alphabet's record-breaking revenue of $102.3 billion. For more on this story, check out the complete report on Benzinga.com.

data.title: Altria's stock falls due to slump in tobacco sales, Q3 earnings: $1.45 per share, $6.072 billion sales (down 3% YoY).
data.description: Altria Group, Inc. saw a decline in its shares as smokeable and oral tobacco sales slumped in the third quarter, impacting year-over-year revenue growth. The company, listed as MO on NYSE, faced negative sentiment due to this. Third-quarter adjusted earnings per share stood at $1.45, marking a 3.6% increase compared to the previous year, aligning with analyst estimates. Quarterly sales reached $6.072 billion, a 3% decrease from the previous year, surpassing the $5.309 billion expected by analysts. The drop in sales was primarily attributed to lower net revenues in the smokeable and oral tobacco segments. Net revenues after excise taxes showed a 1.7% decrease, totaling $5.3 billion. For more details, refer to the full story available on Benzinga.com.

data.title: Analysts lower forecasts on Sprouts Farmers Market after Q3 results; reported sales at $2.2B and EPS of $1.22 per share.
data.description: Sprouts Farmers Market, Inc. (SFM) announced disappointing third-quarter sales figures and provided a fourth-quarter adjusted EPS forecast below expectations. The company posted quarterly earnings of $1.22 per share, surpassing the projected $1.17 per share. Despite this, quarterly sales amounted to $2.200 billion, falling short of the anticipated $2.225 billion. For the fourth quarter, Sprouts Farmers Market anticipates adjusted EPS between 86 cents and 90 cents, contrary to market predictions of 98 cents. CEO Jack Sinclair expressed satisfaction with the performance, attributing it to the nationwide store expansions and alignment with their core consumer base.

data.title: Microsoft shares are down despite surpassing Q1 earnings expectations: $4.13 EPS, $77.7 billion revenue, up 18%, Azure revenue up 40%.
data.description: Microsoft Corporation (NASDAQ: MSFT) shares are experiencing a decline despite impressive fiscal first-quarter results surpassing analyst predictions. The company reported earnings of $4.13 per share, 13% higher than the projected $3.67 and a 23% increase from the previous year. Revenue stood at $77.7 billion, exceeding the estimated $75.3 billion and marking an 18% rise from last year. For the second quarter, Microsoft anticipates revenue between $79.5 billion and $80.6 billion, while analysts expected $79.95 billion. Azure and other cloud services revenue saw a 40% boost year-over-year, and Microsoft Cloud revenue rose by 26% to $49.1 billion. Commercial remaining.
U.S. STATE DEPARTMENT ON TANZANIA: U.S. EMBASSY ADVISES U.S. CITIZENS TO SHELTER-IN-PLACE

data.title: Tech-heavy indexes like Nasdaq 100 fell as Meta dropped 10%, while Google surged 4% on Wall Street Thursday.
data.description: Wall Street experienced a cautious atmosphere on Thursday following mixed earnings reports and Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell's comments. Powell hinted at a possible halt to further rate cuts, leading traders to reduce expectations of a year-end cut from nearly 100% to 65%. The Nasdaq 100 dropped by 0.7%, driven by a 10% decline in Meta Platforms Inc. Microsoft Corp. fell by almost 3%, while Alphabet Inc. surged by 4%, marking its seventh month of gains with a 63% increase. Chipotle saw a sharp decline of over 15% after revising its sales outlook due to macroeconomic challenges. In the geopolitical realm, progress was made in U.S.-China trade talks, with agreements to reduce tariffs and ease export restrictions. Gold prices rebounded by 1.8% to $4,000 per ounce after four consecutive declines.
EARTHQUAKE OF MAGNITUDE 5.74 STRIKES KENAI PENINSULA, ALASKA - REPORTS

data.title: SurgePays offers free wireless service to SNAP/EBT households during shutdown. Includes free talk, text, 3GB data for up to five users per household.
data.description: Each household can now receive free talk, text, and 3GB of data for up to five users. This initiative aims to assist families in need, providing essential communication services without cost. This offer enables each household to connect multiple users at no charge, offering vital connectivity during this time.

data.title: Pantera Capital evaluates Obol Network, highlighting its unique validator tech and blockchain ecosystem impact. (More info)
data.description: Pantera Capital, a prominent investment firm, is closely examining the potential of Obol Network due to its unique approach towards distributed validator technology. The company is highlighting the innovative impact of Obol Network on the blockchain ecosystem. This strategic move is based on the increasing interest in blockchain technologies, with Obol Network standing out for its different approach, attracting attention from industry leaders. By focusing on the advanced technology of distributed validators, Pantera Capital aims to capitalize on the growing trend, recognizing the potential for substantial financial gains.

data.title: Directory lists hundreds of Arab energy companies in various sectors: electrical, power generation, fuel, natural gas, oil & gas.
data.description: A comprehensive directory titled "Major Energy Companies of the Arab World 2025" is now accessible through ResearchAndMarkets.com. This directory encompasses a wide array of companies across the Middle East and North Africa region engaged in various energy sectors including electrical and power generation, fuel distribution, natural gas supply, oil and gas exploration and production, and oil and gas services. It includes information on hundreds of companies offering details such as company names, addresses, telephone and fax numbers, as well as names of senior executives. The directory serves as a valuable resource for industry professionals looking to connect with energy companies in the Arab world.

data.title: TE Connectivity Plc (NYSE: TEL) beats Q4 estimates with $2.44 EPS and $4.75B revenue (17% increase), expects $2.53 EPS in Q1.
data.description: TE Connectivity Plc, trading on NYSE under the ticker TEL, announced impressive fourth-quarter results, surpassing expectations. The company recorded adjusted earnings of $2.44 per share, a 25% increase from the previous year's $1.95 and exceeding analysts' $2.29 forecast. Revenue also saw significant growth, rising 17% to $4.75 billion, outperforming the anticipated $4.58 billion. Organically, revenue increased by 11%, driven by robust performances in the Industrial and Transportation segments. For the upcoming first quarter, TE Connectivity foresees adjusted earnings per share of $2.53, a 23% year-over-year increase, surpassing analysts' $2.17 projection. Sales are expected to reach $4.50 billion, reflecting a 17% rise from the previous year and 11% organic growth, exceeding the estimated $4.34 billion. The company attributed this success to the exceptional execution of its business model. For further details, refer to the full article on Benzinga.com.

data.title: S&P Global reports strong Q3 earnings, with $4.73/share (+21.6% YoY) exceeding $3.89B revenue (+8.8% YoY), operating profit margin at 52.1%. Plans $2.5B repurchases by Q4 2025. Market Intelligence division revenue at $1.24B.
data.description: S&P Global Inc. (NYSE: SPGI) saw a significant increase in its shares following a strong third-quarter performance. The company reported adjusted earnings of $4.73 per share, a 21.6% rise from the previous year and beating analysts' projections of $4.41 per share. Quarterly revenue climbed to $3.89 billion, an 8.8% increase year over year, exceeding estimates of $3.83 billion. The adjusted operating profit margin rose to 52.1%, up 330 basis points. The company ended the quarter with $1.67 billion in cash, cash equivalents, and restricted cash. S&P Global has returned $1.5 billion to shareholders through dividends and repurchases since July and plans to complete an additional $2.5 billion in share repurchases by the end of 2025. All operating segments showed growth in the third quarter, with Market Intelligence division revenue reaching $1.24 billion, a 6% increase year over year.
